info.name: Twitter Manager API
info.description: Complete collection for Twitter Manager API with OAuth 2.0 support and real Twitter posting capabilities

request.description: Check if the API is running. No authentication required.
Test if your API key is valid
Generate Twitter OAuth 2.0 authorization URL with PKCE. Open the returned auth_url in your browser to authorize.
Create a new Twitter thread with multiple connected tweets

response.name: Thread Created

request.description: Post all pending tweets in a thread to Twitter
Get a list of all threads
Get detailed information about a specific thread

request.description: Post all pending threads to X/Twitter with rate limiting. Optionally filter by account_id.
Delete all threads by status (failed, pending, or posted) across all accounts for cleanup.
Retry posting all failed threads with rate limiting. Resets failed tweets to pending and resumes posting from where they left off.
Retry posting a failed thread from where it left off
Reset failed thread tweets back to pending status
Get threads filtered by status. Valid statuses: failed, pending, posted
Automated thread posting service - combines pending posting and failed retry with comprehensive reporting. Used by AWS Lambda automation.

response.name: Automation Success
Dry Run Mode

response.name: Profiles Synced Successfully
Partial Sync (Some Failed)

request.description: Get paginated list of saved followers for an account
Save a single follower for an account
Batch save multiple followers for an account (used by automation)

query.description: Optional: Filter by specific account ID

request.description: Get accounts that gained new followers within specified time period. Returns accounts with their new followers sorted by new follower count.

response.name: Success - 1 Day
Error - Invalid Time Period

request.description:
Delete a specific follower from an account's saved followers list.

Requires:
- account_id: The ID of the account
- follower_id: The ID of the follower to delete (from saved followers table)

This removes the follower from the local database only.
Create a new tweet with 'pending' status
Post a pending tweet to Twitter

response.name: Twitter API Error

request.description: Post tweets with 'pending' status to Twitter in batches. Use batch_size to control how many tweets to process (max 50) and offset for pagination.
Start an asynchronous background job to post all pending tweets. Returns immediately with a job ID to track progress.

response.name: Job Started

request.description: Check the status of a background job for posting tweets
Retry posting a specific failed tweet
Retry multiple failed tweets in batches
Reset failed tweets back to pending status. Use tweet_ids for specific tweets, account_id for all failed tweets of an account, or days_old for tweets older than X days.
Get current rate limit status for all Twitter accounts. Shows tweets posted, remaining, and time until reset.
Get all tweets (max 50)

response.name: Tweet List

request.description: Get overall statistics
Check if Twitter accounts are active, suspended, locked, or have other issues

response.name: Account Status Report

request.description: Check health status of all account tokens
Manually refresh token for a specific account
Refresh all tokens expiring within the next hour
Clear refresh failure count for an account
Check if mock mode is enabled
Enable mock mode (no real Twitter posts)
Disable mock mode (enable real Twitter posts)
Permanently delete an account and all associated data. After migration, this will cascade delete all tweets, threads, and owned lists. Use soft-delete for safer option.
Soft delete an account by marking it as deleted without removing data. Cancels pending/failed tweets and excludes from automation.

response.name: Success - Account Soft Deleted

request.description: Update the Workflowy URL for a specific account. Pass an empty string to clear the URL.
Delete all accounts with specified statuses and their tweets
Delete a specific tweet

response.name: Tweet Deleted

request.description: Delete all failed tweets
Delete tweets older than 30 days
Delete posted tweets older than 7 days from specific account
Delete a specific thread and all its tweets
Delete threads based on criteria (status, age, account)

Delete all tweets from a specific account. Requires explicit confirmation for safety.

Optional filters:
- statuses: array of statuses to delete ['pending', 'posted', 'failed']
- days_old: delete tweets older than X days

Safety: Requires 'confirm: true' to proceed.

response.name: Confirmation Required

request.description:
Delete tweets from X/Twitter using the official API. This PERMANENTLY deletes tweets from Twitter.

Parameters:
- limit: Number of tweets to delete (max 50, default 10)
- include_threads: Delete complete threads (default true)
- tweet_ids: Array of specific tweet IDs to delete (optional)
- confirm: Required safety confirmation (must be true)

Rate Limits:
- Uses Twitter's API rate limits
- Max 50 tweets per request
- Automatically handles rate limiting

Safety:
- Requires explicit confirmation
- Shows detailed results
- Updates local database status

Thread Handling:
- Deletes threads in reverse order (newest first)
- Provides per-thread deletion status

response.name: Bulk Delete Success
Delete Specific Tweets
Rate Limited Response
Confirmation Required

request.description: Set an account as 'list_owner' or 'managed'
Get all accounts that can manage lists
Create a new Twitter list. Owner account must be of type 'list_owner'
Get all lists
Get lists owned by specific account
Get list details including members
Update list name and/or description
Delete a list from Twitter and database
Add multiple accounts to a list
Get all members of a list
Remove an account from a list

Add a username as a follower to all accounts in a list (stored in local database, not on Twitter/X). The follower will be added to the 'follower' table for each account in the specified list.

Required:
- follower_username: The username to add as a follower

Optional:
- follower_id: Twitter ID of the follower
- follower_name: Display name of the follower
- status: Status of the follower (active/inactive, defaults to active)

response.name: Success Response

request.description: Get all lists owned by any Twitter user (not limited to managed accounts)

response.name: Success Response

query.description: Token for next page of results

request.description: Get members of any Twitter list (not limited to managed lists). Supports pagination.

response.name: Success Response

request.description: Sync lists from Twitter for list_owner accounts. If account_ids is empty, syncs all list_owner accounts.
Move accounts between lists. If from_list_id is not provided, just adds to target list.
Get all managed accounts grouped by their list memberships
Get overall DOK statistics across all accounts
Get DOK statistics for a specific account with optional date filtering
Get progress bar data optimized for frontend display with DOK3 vs DOK4 breakdown
Get DOK changes over time for timeline visualization
Get leaderboard of accounts by DOK change activity
Search for tweets with specific DOK patterns and filters
